mtns.description: Mount Elbert is the highest summit of the Rocky Mountains of North America and the highest point in the U.S. state of Colorado and the entire Mississippi River drainage basin. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Mt. Elbert
Mt. Massive
mtns.description: Mount Massive is the second-highest summit of the Rocky Mountains of North America and the U.S. state of Colorado. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: Mt. Harvard
mtns.description: Mount Harvard is the third highest summit of the Rocky Mountains of North America and the U.S. state of Colorado. The prominent 14,421-foot fourteener is the highest summit of the Collegiate Peaks and the fourth highest summit in the contiguous United States. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: La Plata Peak
mtns.description: La Plata Peak is the fifth-highest summit of the Rocky Mountains of North America and the U.S. state of Colorado. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: Mt. Antero
mtns.description: Mount Antero is the highest summit of the southern Sawatch Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. The prominent 14,276-foot fourteener is located in San Isabel National Forest, 12.2 miles southwest by south of the Town of Buena Vista in Chaffee County, Colorado, United States. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: Mt. Shavano
mtns.description: Mount Shavano is a high mountain summit in the southern Sawatch Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. The 14,231-foot fourteener is located in San Isabel National Forest, 6.5 miles north by west of the community of Maysville in Chaffee County, Colorado, United States. - Wikipedia
Mount Belford is a high mountain summit of the Collegiate Peaks in the Sawatch Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Mt. Belford

mtns.description: Mount Princeton is a high and prominent mountain summit of the Collegiate Peaks in the Sawatch Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. The 14,204 feet fourteener is located in San Isabel National Forest, 7.8 miles southwest of the Town of Buena Vista in Chaffee County, Colorado, United States. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Mt. Princeton
Mt. Yale
mtns.description: Mount Yale is a high and prominent mountain summit of the Collegiate Peaks in the Sawatch Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: Tabeguache Peak
mtns.description: Tabeguache Peak is one of the fourteeners of the US state of Colorado. It is a near neighbor of the higher peak Mount Shavano, which lies approximately 1/2 mile to the southeast, and is close to being a subpeak of the latter. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: Mt. Oxford
mtns.description: Mount Oxford is a high mountain summit of the Collegiate Peaks in the Sawatch Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. - Wikipedia
Mount Columbia is a high mountain summit of the Collegiate Peaks in the Sawatch Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Mt. Columbia
Missouri Mountain
mtns.description: Missouri Mountain is a high mountain summit in the Collegiate Peaks of the Sawatch Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: Mt. of the Holy Cross
mtns.description: Mount of the Holy Cross is a high and prominent mountain summit in the northern Sawatch Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. - Wikipedia
Huron Peak is a high mountain summit of the Collegiate Peaks in the Sawatch Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. -
mtns.name: Huron Peak

mtns.description: Blanca Peak is the fourth highest summit of the Rocky Mountains of North America and the U.S. state of Colorado. The ultra-prominent 14,351-foot peak is the highest summit of the Sierra Blanca Massif, the Sangre de Cristo Range, and the Sangre de Cristo Mountains. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Blanca Peak

mtns.description: Crestone Peak is the seventh-highest summit of the Rocky Mountains of North America and the U.S. state of Colorado. The prominent 14,300-foot fourteener is the highest summit of the Crestones and the second-highest summit in the Sangre de Cristo Range after Blanca Peak. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Crestone Peak
Crestone Needle
mtns.description: Crestone Needle is a high mountain summit of the Crestones in the Sangre de Cristo Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. The 14,203-foot fourteener is located 6.9 miles east-southeast of the Town of Crestone in Saguache County, Colorado, United States. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: Kit Carson Peak
mtns.description: Kit Carson Peak is a high mountain summit of the Crestones in the Sangre de Cristo Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. Officially designated Kit Carson Mountain, the 14,171-foot fourteener is located 5.2 miles east by south of the Town of Crestone in Saguache County, Colorado, United States. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: Challenger Point
mtns.description: Challenger Point is a high mountain summit of the Crestones in the Sangre de Cristo Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. The 14,087-foot fourteener is located 5.0 miles east by south of the Town of Crestone in Saguache County, Colorado, United States. - Wikipedia
Humboldt Peak is a high mountain summit of the Crestones in the Sangre de Cristo Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Humboldt Peak
Culebra Peak
mtns.description: Culebra Peak is the highest summit of the Culebra Range of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains in the Rocky Mountains of North America. The prominent 14,053-foot fourteener is located on private land, 14.2 miles east-southeast of the Town of San Luis in Costilla County, Colorado, United States. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: Ellingwood Point
mtns.description: Ellingwood Point is a high mountain summit in the Sangre de Cristo Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. - Wikipedia

Mount Lindsey is a high mountain summit on the Sierra Blanca Massif in the Sangre de Cristo Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. The 14,048-foot fourteener is located in the Sangre de Cristo Land Grant, 10.8 miles north of the community of Fort Garland in Costilla County, Colorado, United States. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Mt. Lindsey
Little Bear Peak
mtns.description: Little Bear Peak is a high mountain summit in the Sangre de Cristo Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: Uncompahgre Peak
mtns.description: Uncompahgre Peak is the sixth highest summit of the Rocky Mountains of North America and the U.S. state of Colorado. The prominent 14,321-foot fourteener is the highest summit of the San Juan Mountains and the highest point in the drainage basin of the Colorado River and the Gulf of California. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: Mt. Wilson
mtns.description: Mount Wilson is the highest summit of the San Miguel Mountains range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. The prominent 14,252-foot fourteener is located in the Lizard Head Wilderness of San Juan National Forest, 10.6 miles north by east of the Town of Rico in Dolores County, Colorado, United States. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: El Diente Peak
mtns.description: El Diente Peak is a high summit in the San Miguel Mountains range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. The 14,165-foot peak is located in the Lizard Head Wilderness of San Juan National Forest, 10.5 miles north by east of the Town of Rico in Dolores County, Colorado, United States. - Wikipedia

Mount Sneffels is the highest summit of the Sneffels Range in the Rocky Mountains of North America. The prominent 14,158-foot fourteener is located in the Mount Sneffels Wilderness of Uncompahgre National Forest, 6.7 miles west by south of the City of Ouray in Ouray County, Colorado, United States. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Mt. Sneffels

mtns.description: Mount Eolus is a high mountain summit of the Needle Mountains range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. The 14,090-foot fourteener is located in the Weminuche Wilderness of San Juan National Forest, 27.4 miles northeast by north of the City of Durango in La Plata County, Colorado, United States. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Mt. Eolus

mtns.description: Windom Peak is the highest summit of the Needle Mountains range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. The prominent 14,093-foot fourteener is located in the Weminuche Wilderness of San Juan National Forest, 28.2 miles northeast by north of the City of Durango in La Plata County, Colorado, United States. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Windom Peak
Sunlight Peak
mtns.description: Sunlight Peak is a high mountain summit of the Needle Mountains range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. The 14,065-foot fourteener is located in the Weminuche Wilderness of San Juan National Forest, 28.5 miles northeast by north of the City of Durango in La Plata County, Colorado, United States. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: Handies Peak
mtns.description: Handies Peak is a high and prominent mountain summit of the San Juan Mountains range in the Rocky Mountains of North America. - Wikipedia

Redcloud Peak is a mountain peak of over fourteen thousand feet in the U.S. state of Colorado. It is located in the San Juan Mountains in Hinsdale County approximately 7 miles south west of Lake City. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Redcloud Peak
Wilson Peak
mtns.description: Wilson Peak is a 14,023-foot mountain peak in the U.S. state of Colorado. It is located in the Lizard Head Wilderness of the Uncompahgre National Forest, in the northwestern San Juan Mountains. It is the highest point in San Miguel County. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: Wetterhorn Peak
mtns.description: Wetterhorn Peak is a fourteen thousand foot mountain peak in the U.S. state of Colorado. It is located in the Uncompahgre Wilderness of the northern San Juan Mountains, in northwestern Hinsdale County and southeastern Ouray County, 9 miles east of the town of Ouray. It lies 2.75 mi west of Uncompahgre Peak. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: San Luis Peak
mtns.description: San Luis Peak is the highest summit of the La Garita Mountains range in the Rocky Mountains of North America. The prominent 14,022-foot fourteener is located in the Gunnison National Forest portion of the La Garita Wilderness in Saguache County approximately 10 miles north of Creede. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: Sunshine Peak
mtns.description: Sunshine Peak is a fourteen thousand foot mountain peak in the U.S. state of Colorado. It is located in the San Juan Mountains in Hinsdale County approximately 9 miles south west of Lake City, and about 1 mile south of Redcloud Peak. It rises on the north side of the Lake Fork of the Gunnison River. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: Mt. Lincoln
mtns.description: Mount Lincoln is the eighth-highest summit of the Rocky Mountains of North America and the U.S. state of Colorado. The prominent 14,293-foot fourteener is the highest summit of the Mosquito Range and the eleventh-highest summit in the contiguous United States. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: Mt. Bross
mtns.description: Mount Bross is a high mountain summit in the Mosquito Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. The 14,178-foot fourteener is located in Pike National Forest, 4.1 miles northwest by north of the Town of Alma in Park County, Colorado, United States. - Wikipedia
Mount Democrat is a high mountain summit in the Mosquito Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Mt. Democrat
Mt. Sherman
mtns.description: Mount Sherman is a high mountain summit in the Mosquito Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. The 14,043-foot fourteener is located 6.8 miles east by south of the City of Leadville, Colorado, United States, on the drainage divide separating Lake County from Park County. - Wikipedia

Grays Peak is the tenth-highest summit of the Rocky Mountains of North America and the U.S. state of Colorado. The prominent 14,278-foot fourteener is the highest summit of the Front Range and the highest point on the Continental Divide in North America. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Grays Peak

mtns.description: Torreys Peak is a mountain in the Front Range region of the Rocky Mountains in Colorado. It is one of 53 fourteeners in Colorado. Its nearest major city is Denver. Torreys Peak is located along the Continental Divide, as well as the division between Clear Creek County and Summit County. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Torreys Peak
Mt. Evans
mtns.description: Mount Evans is the highest peak in the namesake Mount Evans Wilderness in the Front Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. - Wikipedia

Longs Peak is a high and prominent mountain in the northern Front Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. The 14,259-foot fourteener is located in the Rocky Mountain National Park Wilderness, 9.6 miles southwest by south of the Town of Estes Park, Colorado, United States. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Longs Peak

mtns.description: Pikes Peak is the highest summit of the southern Front Range of the Rocky Mountains, in North America. The ultra-prominent 14,115-foot fourteener is located in Pike National Forest, 12 miles west of downtown Colorado Springs, Colorado. The mountain is named in honor of American explorer Zebulon Pike. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Pikes Peak

mtns.description: Mount Bierstadt is a high mountain summit of the Colorado Peaks in the Front Range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. The 14,065-foot fourteener is located in the Mount Evans Wilderness of Pike National Forest, 9.4 miles south by east of the Town of Georgetown in Clear Creek County, Colorado, United States. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Mt. Bierstadt

mtns.description: Quandary Peak is the highest summit of the Tenmile Range in the Rocky Mountains of North America and is the most commonly climbed fourteener in Colorado. It has nearly the same elevation as Castle Peak and Mount Evans. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Quandary Peak
Castle Peak
mtns.description: Castle Peak is the ninth highest summit of the Rocky Mountains of North America and the U.S. state of Colorado. The prominent 14,279-foot fourteener is the highest summit of the Elk Mountains and the Maroon Bells-Snowmass Wilderness. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: Maroon Peak
mtns.description: The Maroon Bells are two peaks in the Elk Mountains, Maroon Peak and North Maroon Peak, separated by about half a kilometer. The mountains are on the border between Pitkin County and Gunnison County, Colorado, United States, about 12 miles southwest of Aspen. Both peaks are fourteeners. - Wikipedia

mtns.name: Capitol Peak
mtns.description: Capitol Peak is a high and prominent mountain summit in the Elk Mountains range of the Rocky Mountains of North America. It is the 52nd highest mountain in North America. - Wikipedia
Snowmass Mountain is a fourteen thousand foot tall mountain in the U.S. state of Colorado, and is the thirty-fourth highest mountain peak in the state. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Snowmass Mountain

mtns.description: Pyramid Peak is a fourteen thousand foot mountain in the U.S. state of Colorado. It is the 47th highest mountain peak in Colorado, and 78th highest peak in the United States. It is located in the Elk Mountains in southeastern Pitkin County, approximately 12 miles southwest of Aspen. - Wikipedia
mtns.name: Pyramid Peak
